Test Case Name: Admin view all orders response time
Description: Verify admin can view all orders within acceptable time
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to orders page
2. Measure page load time
3. Measure API response time
Expected Result:
Page loads within 2 seconds
API responds within 500ms

Test Case Name: Admin view order details response time
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to order details
2. Measure page load time
3. Measure API response time
Expected Result:
Page loads within 2 seconds
API responds within 300ms

Test Case Name: Admin update order status response time
Description: Verify order status update is fast
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to order
2. Change status
3. Measure update time
4. Measure API response time
Expected Result:
Status updates within 2 seconds
API responds within 500ms

Test Case Name: Admin view dashboard summary response time
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Measure page load time
3. Measure aggregation query time
Expected Result:
Dashboard loads within 3 seconds
API responds within 800ms

Test Steps:
1. Send GET request to /api/orders
2. Measure response time
3. Verify data returned

1. Send GET request to /api/orders/:id
2. Measure response time

1. Send PUT request with new status
2. Measure response time
3. Verify status updated

1. Send GET request to /api/orders/summary
2. Measure response time
3. Check aggregation efficiency

Description: Verify system handles concurrent order views
Test Steps:
1. Simulate 20 concurrent order list requests
2. Measure response times
3. Check for errors
Expected Result:
All requests complete successfully
Average response < 1 second

Test Steps:
1. Simulate 10 concurrent status updates
2. Measure response times
3. Verify all updates successful
Expected Result:
All updates complete successfully
No data conflicts

Description: Verify system handles concurrent dashboard loads
Test Steps:
1. Simulate 30 concurrent dashboard requests
2. Measure response times
3. Monitor server resources
Expected Result:
All requests complete within 5 seconds
Server stable

Test Steps:
1. Query orders with 10000+ orders in DB
2. Measure query time
3. Check index usage

1. Run summary aggregation
2. Measure execution time
3. Check query plan

1. Monitor connection pool under load
2. Check connection reuse
3. Verify no connection leaks
Expected Result:
Connections managed efficiently
No leaks detected

Test Steps:
1. Run load test for 10 minutes
2. Monitor server memory
3. Check for memory leaks
Expected Result:
Memory usage stable
No significant leaks

Test Steps:
1. Navigate order list repeatedly
2. Monitor browser memory
3. Check for leaks

1. Apply various filters
2. Measure filter response time
3. Check UI responsiveness

1. Sort by different columns
2. Measure sort response time
3. Check UI responsiveness
